0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis: dose must be individualized using pretreatment functional antithrombin (AT) activity level, body weight of the patient, and by subsequent therapeutic monitoring; goal of therapy is to restore and maintain AT activity levels between 80% to 120% of normal (0.8 to 1.2 international units/mL)
  • Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis: loading dose given as an IV infusion over 15 minutes and immediately followed by a continuous IV maintenance dose; an additional loading dose (followed by a maintenance) infusion may be required if AT activity levels are less than 80% of normal just after surgery or delivery
  • Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis: surgery patients, initiate therapy 24 hr before surgery; loading dose (international units) = ((100 - baseline AT activity level (in % of normal))/2.3) x body weight (in kg); maintenance dose (international units/hr) = ((100 - baseline AT activity level (in % of normal))/10.2) x body weight (in kg)
  • Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis: pregnant patients (requiring a surgical procedure other than a cesarean section), loading dose (international units) = ((100 - baseline AT activity level (in % of normal))/1.3) x body weight (in kg); maintenance dose (international units/hr) = ((100 - baseline AT activity level (in % of normal))/5.4) x body weight (in kg)
  • Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis: subsequent dosing based on AT activity monitoring; less than 80% AT activity level, increase dose by 30%; 80% to 120% AT activity level, no dose adjustment; greater than 120% AT activity level, decrease dose by 30%

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness not established in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Antithrombin III deficiency, Hereditary - Thromboembolic disorder, Peri-operative or Peri-partum; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to goat and goat milk proteins

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• anaphylaxis and severe allergic hypersensitivity reactions may occur
  • concomitant use with anticoagulant agents that use antithrombin to exert an anticoagulant effect (eg, heparin, low molecular weight heparin)
  • report suspected adverse reactions to Ovation Pharmaceuticals at 1-800-455-1141 or the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Injection site reaction (5% or greater)
Serious
  • Gastrointestinal:Hemorrhage of abdominal cavity structure (2%)
  • Hematologic:Hemorrhage (5% or greater), Hemorrhage, Post procedural
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction
  • Musculoskeletal:Hemarthrosis (2%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Recombinant antithrombin is produced by recombinant DNA technology using genetically engineered goats. The DNA coding for human antithrombin was introduced along with a mammary gland specific DNA sequence into the goats resulting in the expression of the antithrombin into the milk. Antithrombin reduces the risk of venous thromboembolism by complexing with thrombin and Factor Xa, thereby neutralizing their activity in the process of coagulation. When antithrombin is bound to heparin, the thrombin and Factor Xa inhibition is enhanced greater than 300 to 1000-fold.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • bring vial to room temperature no more than 3 hr prior to reconstitution
  • reconstitute with SWI immediately prior to use; do not shake
  • add solution to a syringe or dilute in NS to a final concentration of 100 international units/mL
  • administer through an in-line 0.22 micron filter
  • use solution in syringe or diluted product within 8 to 12 hr of preparation when stored at room temperature
  • administer loading dose as a 15-min IV infusion followed immediately by continuous maintenance infusion

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• target antithrombin activity level range of 80% to 120% of normal (0.8 to 1.2 international units/mL)
  • antithrombin activity levels; initial, check level 2 hr after therapy initiation and once or twice daily
  • antithrombin activity levels; if level is less than 80% or greater than 120% of normal, adjust dose and recheck level in 2 hr; if level is 80% to 120% of normal, recheck in 6 hr
  • surgical patients: plasma antithrombin level 24 hr prior to and just after surgery
  • pregnant patients: plasma antithrombin level prior to and just after delivery

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: Advise patient to report signs/symptoms of bleeding or injection site reactions.
